title: Dish 1
instruction: Prepare the lentils according to the instructions on the package. Preheat the oven to 175 ° C. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper

In the meantime, peel and dice the onion. Clean and roughly chop the mushrooms. Prepare the vegetable stock according to the package instructions and set aside. Wash parsley, shake dry and roughly chop
Heat the oil in a pan on medium heat. Steam the onions in it for about 3 minutes until translucent. Add the mushrooms and cumin and cook for another 3 - 4 minutes

Put the oatmeal in a blender and mix into flour. Add the cooked lentils, the contents of the pan, two thirds of the parsley, soy sauce and pepper. Mix until everything is well mixed and roughly chopped (it should not be finely pureed). Let it steep for about 10 minutes

In the meantime, wash the potatoes thoroughly. Cover with water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Cook for about 20 minutes, until the potatoes are soft when pierced. Then drain, allow to evaporate briefly and peel
Shape the lentil mixture into balls with damp hands and place on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the balls with a little oil. Then bake in the oven for 25 minutes. Turn halfway through

Put the vegetable stock, coconut milk, yeast flakes and soy sauce in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Dissolve starch in a little cold water and stir. Then stir into the boiling sauce and simmer on low heat for 3-5 minutes until the sauce is creamy. Season to taste with salt and pepper
Arrange jacket potatoes with Köttbullar and cream sauce on plates. Sprinkle with the rest of the parsley and serve with the cranberries
tip: Everyone knows Köttbullar, but you have certainly not tried them in this vegan version. The Swedish classic is a source of fiber along with potatoes.
